user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 is: Language extensions should not be used.
You should report only when the code uses any language compiler extensions that are explicitly stated as an extension in compiler documentations.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_CountSemTimedWait:
```c
int32 OS_CountSemTimedWait(osal_id_t sem_id, uint32 msecs)
{
    OS_object_token_t token;
    int32             return_code;

    /* Check Parameters */
    return_code = OS_ObjectIdGetById(OS_LOCK_MODE_NONE, LOCAL_OBJID_TYPE, sem_id, &token);
    if (return_code == OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        return_code = OS_CountSemTimedWait_Impl(&token, msecs);
    }

    return return_code;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function OS_CountSemTimedWait:
typedef uint32 osal_id_t
...
typedef struct OS_object_token OS_object_token_t
...
typedef int32_t   int32
...
typedef uint32_t  uint32
...
#define OS_SUCCESS (0)
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: No compiler language extensions are used in the provided code fragment. The function and its symbols use only standard C constructs: typedef aliases for fixed-width integer types (int32_t, uint32_t), a forward declaration typedef for a struct (typedef struct OS_object_token OS_object_token_t), ordinary local variable declarations, function calls, and standard comments. There are no occurrences of known compiler extensions such as __attribute__, __asm, __builtin_*, typeof, statement-expressions ({ ... }), nested functions, zero-length arrays, anonymous structs/unions with compiler-specific syntax, or nonstandard lexical tokens. Declaring a typedef name for a struct (an incomplete type) is standard C; instantiating the variable token requires the complete definition to be visible at the point of compilation, but that is a correctness/visibility issue, not a language-extension usage. Therefore there are no fragments that need investigation under MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 (language extensions should not be used).
